description: Kernels and ramdisks get an ID assigned that starts with "ami-". That should be "aki-" and "ari-", respectively.
title: Image type is not taken into consideration when generating image ID

comments.content: Kernels and ramdisks get an ID assigned that starts with "ami-". That should be "aki-" and "ari-", respectively.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content: I assume this is only for the EC2 API?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content:
It looks like this may have already been implemented (I see this is a fairly "old" ticket):

http://paste.openstack.org/show/188/

bzr blame doesn't give much information on this, so either the code above was always in place and simply isn't functioning, or the OP could be considered Merged/Released.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jk0

comments.content: Yes but it doesnt acutally work.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zulcss

comments.content:
20:50 <+soren> jk0: The problem is that it's not the objectstore that assigns the id.
20:50 <+soren> jk0: The API server does.
20:50 <+soren> jk0: And the API server doesn't inspect the manifest to actually figure out if it's a kernel, ramdisk or machine image.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren
